etymologies: mid 18th century: from modern Latin analis, from Latin anus (see anus)

definitions: involving, relating to, or situated near the anus
shortDefinitions: relating to or situated near anus

definitions: (in Freudian psychoanalysis) relating to or denoting a stage of infantile psychosexual development supposedly preoccupied with the anus and defecation.
shortDefinitions: (in Freudian theory) of stage of infantile psychosexual development in which defecation is major source of sensuous pleasure

examples.text: he's anal about things like that
